title: Bachelor of Science - Organic Chemistry | Hunter College - City University of New York
description: • Synthesized and characterized theoretically significant molecules to expand our understanding of aromaticity

title: MS and PhD - Molecular Neuroscience | Columbia University Irving Medical Center
description:
• Characterized a novel role of the amyloid precursor protein (APP) in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease.
  • Trained and supervised several undergraduate students.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow | Columbia University Irving Medical Center
description:
• Investigated the role of small Rho-GTPases in Alzheimer's disease, which have also been linked to various cancers
  • Contributed to a bioinformatics project for a non-biased approach to identify Alzheimer's disease associated genes
  • Generated and characterized transgenic mouse models to investigate the roles of several novel genes in driving Alzheimer's disease pathology
  • Developed various gene editing tools (RNAi, viral vectors) to identify molecular pathways contributing to synaptic dysfunction
  • Engineered and characterized various stable cell lines
  • Organized journal club sessions for graduate students
  • Trained several undergraduate and master's students

title: Principal Investigator | Columbia University Irving Medical Center
description:
• Led a translational research program focused on identifying novel biomarkers and druggable proteins involved in Alzheimer's and Huntington's disease pathogenesis; responsible for all aspects of the execution of projects, including regulatory obligations
  • Identified and characterized several previously unknown genes in Alzheimer's disease and investigated their potential as therapeutic targets
  • Designed experiments, reviewed, analyzed, and interpreted data, performed quality control, and managed records
  • Procured and allocated resources to research projects, including recruiting, training, and supervising staff
  • Managed daily laboratory operations, including establishing priorities and assignments, managing budgets, resolving technical difficulties, and documenting issues related to methods and data
  • Drafted and reviewed journal and grant manuscripts, SOPs, protocols, and progress reports
  • Established and maintained cross-functional institutional and international collaborations
  • Conducted lectures for medical and graduate students and led various career development workshops

title: Certificate - Data Analytics and Visualization | Columbia University School of Engineering
description:
• E.T.L. pipelines (Pandas, Numpy, SciPy, BeautifulSoup, Postgres, MongDB), JavaScript, HTML/CSS
  • Data visualization (Matplotlib, Plotly, Leaflet, D3, Tableau)
  • Machine Learning (Scikit, TensorFlow)

title: Freelance Data Scientist | Remote
description:
• Analytics Intell
    • Assist in the development of a state-of-the-art floor mapping and customer relationship management platform for casino operators and integrated resort managers
    • Perform quantitative and qualitative analyses, develop mathematical models, and conduct research on improving casino floor performance
    • Interface with subject-matter experts in the casino industry to analyze and interpret operational and procedural information, and relay to production team to customize solutions
    • Key achievements: Implemented various time series forecasting methods to predict surge in customers to optimize staffing strategies; developed a recommendation engine built in python to recommend optimal slot machine placement to optimize performance, including occupancy and coin-in metrics
  • Insight Health Analytics
    • Perform quantitative analyses, develop mathematical business models, and conduct research on improving patient access to specialty pharmaceutical products
    • Develop predictive sales and revenue forecast models for Market Access Strategy and Patient Support Services teams
    • Design visualizations and draft reports and presentations for clients

title: Assistant Director for Research Integrity and Compliance | Columbia University
description:
• Develop and provide training, education, and outreach to all researchers, including utilizing innovative efforts to communicate compliance initiatives and resources (i.e., websites, social media, newsletters, etc.)
  • Collaborate with various stakeholders in developing new programs and initiatives focused on education and trainings for scientific rigor
  • Conduct research compliance risk assessments and continuous monitoring processes with implementation of corrective actions/improvement plans, as needed
  • Provide consultations to investigators for data management plans and research study design
  • Serve as point of contact with external regulators on research compliance matters
  • Facilitates inquiries, investigations and reporting concerning allegations of research misconduct
  • Key achievements: created new metrics to measure impact of outreach initiatives and trainings; developed an automated process using convolutional neural network, built in python, to process and analyze images to detect potential manipulations
